meanings.definition: Provide with necessary articles of equipment for a particular purpose.
meanings.sent1: The knight accoutered himself with armor before heading into battle.
meanings.sent2: The hiker accoutered his backpack with all the essentials for the long journey.
meanings.sent3: The chef accoutered his kitchen with the finest tools, ready to create culinary masterpieces.
meanings.sent4: The scientist accoutered her lab with cutting-edge technology to conduct groundbreaking research.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter accoutered his gear, prepared to face any emergency with confidence.

meanings.sent1: The accoutered soldier marched proudly in his uniform.
meanings.sent2: The accoutered athlete was ready for the championship game.
meanings.sent3: The accoutered explorer braved the wilderness in search of new discoveries.
meanings.sent4: The accoutered musician took the stage, fully prepared to entertain the audience.
meanings.sent5: The accoutered detective solved the case with all the necessary tools at hand.
